required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Anatomical Reconstruction of Mandibular Bone Defects Using a Statistical Shape Model
clinical_study.official_title: Virtual Anatomical Reconstruction of Mandibular Bone Defects Using a Statistical Shape Model

brief_summary.textblock: Hundred already taken CT-scans (50 male and 50 female) will be anonymized. These scans will be segmented and implemented into a statistical shape model that will be used to predict missing hard tissue of a mandible based on the remaining bone.

detailed_description.textblock: Together with the radiology and Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) department, 100 scans will be selected from the database (50 males and 50 females, between 20 and 60 years old). First, they will be anonymized (except the sex and age/date of birth). Afterwards, they will be segmented using Materialise Mimics software. The segmented mandibles will then be used to create a statistical shape model (SSM) using principal component analysis. This model will afterwards be used to predict the mandibular shapes.

primary_outcome.measure: A statistical shape model of a mandible
primary_outcome.description: A statistical shape model of a mandible

arm_group.description: Belgian adults (between 20 and 60 years old), 50/50 male/female, with no major mandibular problems/deformities

intervention.description: CT-scans will be evaluated (to see if they are included in the research group) and segmented if they are accepted.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy mandibles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mandibles with major deformities
- Mandibles with obvious problems
- Mandibles that already underwent surgery
